org.bsiet.combinations

Class LabelledTextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledTextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LabelledTextArea
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    The Java Wizard Development team

    Use

    A component that gives you JLabel and JTextArea next to it as a single component aligned in GroupLayout.
    You can even choose whether you want its alignment in HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL orientation.
    It supports all methods supported by both JLabel and JTextArea.
    This component is returned in JPanel. So you either can initialize it as object or can store it in JPanel too.

    Sample Class


    import javax.swing.JPanel;
    import org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledTextArea;
    import org.bsiet.layouts.MyLayout;

    public class LabelledTextAreaSample extends JPanel {

    LabelledTextArea lta1, lta2;

    public LabelledTextAreaSample()
    {
    lta1 = new LabelledTextArea("Label1", 150, 100, false);
    lta2 = new LabelledTextArea("Label2", 150, 100, true);

    MyLayout ml = new MyLayout(new Object[]{lta1, lta2}, true);
    add(ml);
    }
    }
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public LabelledTextArea(java.lang.String labelName,
                boolean isVertical)
        Instantiates a new LabelledTextArea with specified label and orientation as boolean.
        Parameters:
        labelName - the label name.
        isVertical - Aligns the LabelledTextArea in VERTICAL or HORIZONTAL orientation referred by boolean isVertical.
           true - Tell's LabelledTextArea to be generated in VERTICAL orientation.
           false - Tell's LabelledTextArea to be generated in HORIZONTAL orientation.

        1.7

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
